segments.en: Linked Discourses 3
3. Kosala
25. The Simile of the Mountain
At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho rājānaṃ pasenadiṃ kosalaṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: King Pasenadi of Kosala sat to one side, and the Buddha said to him,

segments.pli: “handa kuto nu tvaṃ, mahārāja, āgacchasi divā divassā”ti?
segments.en: “So, great king, where are you coming from in the middle of the day?”

segments.pli: “Yāni tāni, bhante, raññaṃ khattiyānaṃ muddhāvasittānaṃ issariyamadamattānaṃ kāmagedhapariyuṭṭhitānaṃ janapadatthāvariyappattānaṃ mahantaṃ pathavimaṇḍalaṃ abhivijiya ajjhāvasantānaṃ rājakaraṇīyāni bhavanti, tesu khvāhaṃ, etarahi ussukkamāpanno”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, there are anointed aristocratic kings who are infatuated with authority, and obsessed with greed for sensual pleasures. They have attained stability in the country, occupying a vast conquered territory. Today I have been busy fulfilling the duties of such kings.”
“What do you think, great king?

segments.pli: idha te puriso āgaccheyya puratthimāya disāya saddhāyiko paccayiko.
segments.en: Suppose a trustworthy and reliable man were to come from the east.
He’d approach you and say:

segments.pli: ‘yagghe, mahārāja, jāneyyāsi, ahaṃ āgacchāmi puratthimāya disāya.
segments.en: ‘Please sir, you should know this. I come from the east.

segments.pli: Tatthaddasaṃ mahantaṃ pabbataṃ abbhasamaṃ, sabbe pāṇe nippothento āgacchati.
segments.en: There I saw a huge mountain that reached the clouds. And it was coming this way, crushing all creatures.

segments.pli: Yaṃ te, mahārāja, karaṇīyaṃ, taṃ karohī’ti.
segments.en: So then, great king, do what you must!’

segments.pli: Atha dutiyo puriso āgaccheyya pacchimāya disāya … pe …
segments.en: Then a second trustworthy and reliable man were to come from the west …

segments.pli: atha tatiyo puriso āgaccheyya uttarāya disāya …
segments.en: a third from the north …

segments.pli: atha catuttho puriso āgaccheyya dakkhiṇāya disāya saddhāyiko paccayiko.
segments.en: and a fourth from the south.
He’d approach you and say:

segments.pli: ‘yagghe, mahārāja, jāneyyāsi, ahaṃ āgacchāmi dakkhiṇāya disāya.
segments.en: ‘Please sir, you should know this. I come from the south.

segments.pli: Tatthaddasaṃ mahantaṃ pabbataṃ abbhasamaṃ sabbe pāṇe nippothento āgacchati.
segments.en: There I saw a huge mountain that reached the clouds. And it was coming this way, crushing all creatures.

segments.pli: Yaṃ te, mahārāja, karaṇīyaṃ taṃ karohī’ti.
segments.en: So then, great king, do what you must!’

segments.pli: Evarūpe te, mahārāja, mahati mahabbhaye samuppanne dāruṇe manussakkhaye dullabhe manussatte kimassa karaṇīyan”ti?
segments.en: Should such a dire threat arise—a terrible loss of human life, when human birth is so rare—what would you do?”

segments.pli: “Evarūpe me, bhante, mahati mahabbhaye samuppanne dāruṇe manussakkhaye dullabhe manussatte kimassa karaṇīyaṃ aññatra dhammacariyāya aññatra samacariyāya aññatra kusalakiriyāya aññatra puññakiriyāyā”ti?
segments.en: “Sir, what could I do but practice the teachings, practice morality, doing skillful and good actions?”

segments.pli: “Ārocemi kho te, mahārāja, paṭivedemi kho te, mahārāja, adhivattati kho taṃ, mahārāja, jarāmaraṇaṃ.
segments.en: “I tell you, great king, I announce to you: old age and death are advancing upon you.

segments.pli: Adhivattamāne ce te, mahārāja, jarāmaraṇe kimassa karaṇīyan”ti?
segments.en: Since old age and death are advancing upon you, what would you do?”

segments.pli: “Adhivattamāne ca me, bhante, jarāmaraṇe kimassa karaṇīyaṃ aññatra dhammacariyāya samacariyāya kusalakiriyāya puññakiriyāya?
segments.en: “Sir, what can I do but practice the teachings, practice morality, doing skillful and good actions?

segments.pli: Yāni tāni, bhante, raññaṃ khattiyānaṃ muddhāvasittānaṃ issariyamadamattānaṃ kāmagedhapariyuṭṭhitānaṃ janapadatthāvariyappattānaṃ mahantaṃ pathavimaṇḍalaṃ abhivijiya ajjhāvasantānaṃ hatthiyuddhāni bhavanti;
segments.en: Sir, there are anointed aristocratic kings who are infatuated with authority, and obsessed with greed for sensual pleasures. They have attained stability in the country, occupying a vast conquered territory. Such kings engage in battles of elephants,

segments.pli: tesampi, bhante, hatthiyuddhānaṃ natthi gati natthi visayo adhivattamāne jarāmaraṇe.
Yānipi tāni, bhante, raññaṃ khattiyānaṃ muddhāvasittānaṃ … pe …

segments.en: cavalry,
chariots,
or infantry.

segments.pli: tesampi, bhante, pattiyuddhānaṃ natthi gati natthi visayo adhivattamāne jarāmaraṇe.
segments.en: But there is no place, no scope for such battles when old age and death are advancing.

segments.pli: Santi kho pana, bhante, imasmiṃ rājakule mantino mahāmattā, ye pahonti āgate paccatthike mantehi bhedayituṃ.
segments.en: In this royal court there are ministers of wise counsel who are capable of dividing an approaching enemy by wise counsel.

segments.pli: Tesampi, bhante, mantayuddhānaṃ natthi gati natthi visayo adhivattamāne jarāmaraṇe.
segments.en: But there is no place, no scope for such diplomatic battles when old age and death are advancing.

segments.pli: Saṃvijjati kho pana, bhante, imasmiṃ rājakule pahūtaṃ hiraññasuvaṇṇaṃ bhūmigatañceva vehāsaṭṭhañca, yena mayaṃ pahoma āgate paccatthike dhanena upalāpetuṃ.
segments.en: In this royal court there is abundant gold coin and bullion stored in dungeons and towers. Using this wealth we can pay off an approaching enemy.

segments.pli: Tesampi, bhante, dhanayuddhānaṃ natthi gati natthi visayo adhivattamāne jarāmaraṇe.
segments.en: But there is no place, no scope for such monetary battles when old age and death are advancing.

segments.pli: Adhivattamāne ca me, bhante, jarāmaraṇe kimassa karaṇīyaṃ aññatra dhammacariyāya samacariyāya kusalakiriyāya puññakiriyāyā”ti?
segments.en: When old age and death are advancing, what can I do but practice the teachings, practice morality, doing skillful and good actions?”
“That’s so true, great king! That’s so true!

segments.pli: Adhivattamāne jarāmaraṇe kimassa karaṇīyaṃ aññatra dhammacariyāya samacariyāya kusalakiriyāya puññakiriyāyā”ti?
segments.en: When old age and death are advancing, what can you do but practice the teachings, practice morality, doing skillful and good actions?”
That is what the Buddha said.
Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
“Suppose there were vast mountains
of solid rock touching the sky
drawing in from all sides
and crushing the four quarters.
So too old age and death
advance upon all living creatures—
aristocrats, brahmins, merchants,
workers, outcastes, and scavengers.
They spare nothing.
They crush all beneath them.
There’s nowhere for elephants to take a stand,
nor chariots nor infantry.
They can’t be defeated
by diplomatic battles or by wealth.
That’s why an astute person,
seeing what’s good for themselves,
being wise, would place faith
in the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.
Whoever lives by the teaching
in body, speech, and mind,
is praised in this life
and departs to rejoice in heaven.”
The Linked Discourses with the Kosalan are completed.

suttaplex.blurb: Old age and death roll in upon all like mountains approaching from the four directions, crushing all in their path
